oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Uterine Torsion in Llamas and Alpacas
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cebra, Christopher
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: uterine torsion
dystocia
colic
malpresentations
crias
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Uterine torsion is a recognized cause of dystocia in large animals. Relative frequency and severity vary between species, but both dam and offspring can be saved and torsion corrected if the condition is diagnosed in a timely fashion. Uterine torsion is recognized as a cause of colic and dystocia in llamas and alpacas, but is usually regarded as less common than malpresentations involving the long neck and limbs of crias. In fact, uterine torsion may be responsible for some of those malpresentations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007; 174-175
